page.title: 15HOLY CROSS CHURCH (SARRATT).
page.content: The present church was built in 1190. There may have been an earlier building on this site,but no-one knows for sure. The original building has been restored several times,the most extensive being in the 19th.Century. Like many old buildings in Downland areas,flint is used as a major building material. Stain glass windows form a dramatic part of the church structure.There are windows depicting the Crucifiction and Ascension. In oldest headstones in the churchyard are those of the inhabitants of Rose Hall Farm and Goldington's,which are up to 700 years old.This is because they were the only ones wealthy enough to be able to afford them.During the restoration work of 1860,a Norman coffin lid was discovered.This is now preserved inside the church.
